workbook.name: A simple illustration of geofencing
workbook.description: This workbook illustrates a typical example of Kinetica can be used to setup a geofence

9d013c40-0f69-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.name: Block 1
9d013c40-0f69-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.content:
"CREATE OR REPLACE TABLE geofence.vehicle_locations
(
    x float,
    y float,
    TRACKID varchar(64),
    DEPOT_ID integer,
    sids integer,
    TIMESTAMP timestamp,
    shard_key(TRACKID)
)"

9d013c40-0f69-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.name: Block
9d013c40-0f69-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"CREATE THE SCHEMA FOR THE EXAMPLE","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Kinetica uses schema's to organize tables. It is good practice to have a schema defined for each project. Tables that are created without an explicit schema assignment are placed in the default schema ki_home."}]}]

9d013c40-0f69-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.name: Block
9d013c40-0f69-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"LOAD THE DATA","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"We will be using a stream of vehicle locations. The steps for loading this data are as follows."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"1. Define the table"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"2. Set up the credentials for connecting to the kafka cluster (Optional)"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"3. Define the data source"}]}]

9d013c40-0f69-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.name: Block
9d013c40-0f69-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.content:
"-- Credentials for the kafka cluster
CREATE OR REPLACE CREDENTIAL geofence.confluent_creds
TYPE = 'kafka'
WITH OPTIONS (
    'security.protocol' = 'SASL_SSL',
    'sasl.mechanism' = 'PLAIN',
    'sasl.username'='FKHU5OKQSM6J3FZY',
    'sasl.password'='BT0b0049Q016ncuMUD0Pt5bRPr6YZu9YNioEtGqfuaN1pPmwyPUVMytUWloqtt8o'
)"

9d013c40-0f69-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.name: Block
9d013c40-0f69-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.content:
"CREATE OR REPLACE DATA SOURCE geofence.vehicle_locations_source
LOCATION = 'kafka://pkc-ep9mm.us-east-2.aws.confluent.cloud:9092'
WITH OPTIONS (
    'kafka_topic_name' =  'vehicle_locations',
    credential = 'geofence.confluent_creds'
)"

9d013c40-0f69-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.name: Block
9d013c40-0f69-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.content:
"-- Reducing the default batch size for kafka so that tracks appear smooth. Larger batch sizes will render as big jumps when visualizing tracks.
ALTER SYSTEM SET PROPERTIES ('kafka_batch_size' = '1');

-- Start loading the data into the previously defined table
LOAD DATA INTO geofence.vehicle_locations
FROM FILE PATH ''
FORMAT JSON
WITH OPTIONS (
    DATA SOURCE = 'geofence.vehicle_locations_source',
    KAFKA_GROUP_ID = 'BH_90210',
    SUBSCRIBE = TRUE,
    TYPE_INFERENCE_MODE = 'speed'

)"

13454450-0f6a-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.name: Block
13454450-0f6a-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"This workbook illustrates the concept of geofencing using Kinetica."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"WHAT IS GEOFENCING?","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Geofencing is the ability to classify an object as being inside a defined geographical boundary. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"bold":true,"text":"WHAT IS A COMMON USECASE FOR GEOFENCING?"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The most common use case for geofencing is to trigger an event (for instance an alert) when an object is inside or outside the fence. Some examples include, "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"1. Triggering an alert when a vehicle enters a restricted zone, "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"2. Alerting a customer when a delivery truck carrying a package is within a certain distance from their home"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"3. Sending alerts to a customer when they are close to certain locations they may be interested in visiting"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"HOW DOES THIS EXAMPLE WORK?","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"This example illustrates the first use case described above. Our data input for this example is a stream via Kafka of vehicle locations (6 vehicles). We are interested in knowing when a particular vehicle (vehicle 5) is inside a certain zone of interest in downtown Washington DC. For illustration purposes, we will stream the alerts to a webhook but you can alternatively set these up to be registered via kafka or any other custom application like Slack (via webhooks)."}]}]

8d1aecb0-0f6c-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.name: Block 1
8d1aecb0-0f6c-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.content: "-- A temporary table to show the envelope on the map\nCREATE OR REPLACE TEMP TABLE geofence.temp_envelope AS \nSELECT ST_MAKEENVELOPE(-77.05, 38.90, -77.0, 38.885) AS zone"

8d1aecb0-0f6c-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.name: Block
8d1aecb0-0f6c-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"VISUALIZE THE VEHICLE LOCATIONS","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Let's start by getting a sense for the location and movement of the vehicles. The speed of the vehicle is a bit accelerated for the demo for illustration purposes. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"We will be specifically looking at vehicle 5. So we will start by setting up a materialized view which refreshes every 5 seconds to record new locations that are streaming in. The map below show the vehicle moving through downtown area in DC."}]}]

8d1aecb0-0f6c-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.name: Block
8d1aecb0-0f6c-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.content:
"CREATE STREAM geofence.vehicle_inzone
ON TABLE geofence.vehicle_5
    REFRESH ON CHANGE
    WHERE STXY_CONTAINS(
        ST_MAKEENVELOPE(-77.05, 38.90, -77.0, 38.885), 
        X, 
        Y) = 1
WITH OPTIONS 
(
    DESTINATION = 'PASTE THE WEHOOK URL HERE'
)"

8d1aecb0-0f6c-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.name: Block
8d1aecb0-0f6c-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.content:
"-- Create a materialized view that refreshes every 5 seconds to register vehicle locations
CREATE OR REPLACE MATERIALIZED VIEW geofence.vehicle_5
REFRESH EVERY 5 SECONDS AS
SELECT * 
FROM geofence.vehicle_locations
WHERE TRACKID = '5'
"

8d1aecb0-0f6c-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.name: Block
8d1aecb0-0f6c-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"CREATE A ZONE OF INTEREST","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"ST_MAKEENVELOPE() is a function from Kinetica's geospatial library of functions that can be used to create a spatial polygon. We will use it to create a polygon around the DC mall area. This will be our zone of interest."}]}]

8d1aecb0-0f6c-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.name: Block
8d1aecb0-0f6c-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"SETUP A STREAM","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"A stream in Kinetica can be used to publish changes on a table to a target destination. This target could be a webhook or a Kafka topic. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"GO TO WEBHOOK.SITE TO TRY THIS EXAMPLE ON YOUR OWN","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The easiest way to test this code out is by using a webhook. You can generate one for free and observe requests coming in via the following website: https://webhook.site/."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Please visit "},{"text":"https://webhook.site/ ","bold":true},{"text":"to generate a webhook and paste it in the code below to create the stream. Once the stream is setup head back over to https://webhook.site/ to observe the requests coming in."}]}]

1bd06ed0-0f6d-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.name: Block
1bd06ed0-0f6d-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"CLEAN UP","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"1. Reset the Kafka ingest batch size back to the default setting."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"2. Drop the schema and associated data objects"}]}]

1bd06ed0-0f6d-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.name: Block 1
1bd06ed0-0f6d-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.content: "-- Resetting the batch size back to default\nALTER SYSTEM SET PROPERTIES ('kafka_batch_size' = '1000')"

1bd06ed0-0f6d-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.name: Block
1bd06ed0-0f6d-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Drop the schema and all the tables inside it."}]}]

1bd06ed0-0f6d-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.name: Block
1bd06ed0-0f6d-11ed-ac41-c95f096e32ba.content: "-- Drop the schema (and associated data objects)\nDROP SCHEMA IF EXISTS geofence CASCADE"
